div.l: He can wel in myn eye fynde a stalk
But in his owne he can not see abalkA 3920
The revꝭes tale
Aatt Trumpyngton not fer fro caunterbrugge3921
Þ̉ere goth a brook ⁊and ouᵉer þat a brugge
Vpon þᵉ whych brook þ̉er standeth a mulle
And þis is verrey soth þᵗat I ȝow telle
A myller was þ̉er dwellynge many aday
As any pocok he was stoute ⁊and gay
Pypen he couth ⁊and fysshen ⁊and nettes bete
And tᵘurne cuppes ⁊and well wrastell ⁊and shete
And by his belt he bar a long pinade
And of a swerd full trenchant was þᵉ blade3930
A ioly popper he bare in his pouche
Þ̉ere was no man for perell durste hym touche
A shefeld thwytell bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face ⁊and a vinoyse was his nose
AsAAs pylled as an ape was his skolle
He was a market bet̉er at þᵉ fulle
Þ̉er durst no wyth honde vpon hym ley
Þat he ne swore anon he sholde abey
A þef he was for soþe of corn ⁊and mele
And þat a sleyh ⁊and vsant forte stele3940
His name was hote deynous symkyn
A wif he had comen of noble kyn
Þᵉ ꝑperson of þᵉ toun her fadᵉer was
Wᵗith her he ȝaf a panne of bras
For þᵗat symkyn in his blod sholde ally
She was fostered in a nonnery
For symkyn wolde no wyf as he sayde394
